name: EPIC 249893012
scenarioDescription:
The EPIC 249893012 Exoplanetary System

EPIC 249893012 is a star with 1.05 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.71 times its radius. It is located 1057.46 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 9 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

EPIC 249893012 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

EPIC 249893012 b

EPIC 249893012 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2020-01. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 3.60 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, EPIC 249893012.

Its eccentricity, the extent to which the shape of the exoplanet's orbit departs from a perfect circle (Earth's is 0.0167, which is why the shape of Earth's orbit is circular rather than oval in appearance), is 0.06, which means that when EPIC 249893012 b is at is at its closest point to its host star, 0.04 astronomical units separates the two, and when it is at its farthest point, this number is 0.05. In the case of Earth, these numbers are 0.9832899 and 1.0167103 respectively.

The mass of EPIC 249893012 b is 8.75 times the mass of Earth. The radius of EPIC 249893012 b is 1.95 that of Earth. At 8.75 Earth masses, EPIC 249893012 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

EPIC 249893012 c

EPIC 249893012 c was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2020-01. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 15.62 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, EPIC 249893012.

Its eccentricity, the extent to which the shape of the exoplanet's orbit departs from a perfect circle (Earth's is 0.0167, which is why the shape of Earth's orbit is circular rather than oval in appearance), is 0.07, which means that when EPIC 249893012 c is at is at its closest point to its host star, 0.12 astronomical units separates the two, and when it is at its farthest point, this number is 0.14. In the case of Earth, these numbers are 0.9832899 and 1.0167103 respectively.

The mass of EPIC 249893012 c is 14.67 times the mass of Earth. The radius of EPIC 249893012 c is 3.67 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, EPIC 249893012 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

EPIC 249893012 d

EPIC 249893012 d was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2020-01. Its semi-major axis is 0.22 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 35.75 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, EPIC 249893012.

Its eccentricity, the extent to which the shape of the exoplanet's orbit departs from a perfect circle (Earth's is 0.0167, which is why the shape of Earth's orbit is circular rather than oval in appearance), is 0.15, which means that when EPIC 249893012 d is at is at its closest point to its host star, 0.19 astronomical units separates the two, and when it is at its farthest point, this number is 0.25. In the case of Earth, these numbers are 0.9832899 and 1.0167103 respectively.

The mass of EPIC 249893012 d is 10.18 times the mass of Earth. The radius of EPIC 249893012 d is 3.94 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, EPIC 249893012 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system EPIC 249893012, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by K2.
